page.title: 11Education
page.content: Our school is called West Hill Juniors. It is a very old school built originally in 1876. The school is separated into two parts-the main block and senior block which used to be an old army hospital but has been modernised with carpets and blinds. At the present time there are 308 children attending, aged between 7-11 years. There are 14 teachers including the headmaster. We are taught English, Maths,Science,History,Geography,Music, Art and Craft,Religion and Drama. We also have P.E, Games and Swimming lessons. There are lots of clubs after school like Netball,Football,Pottery, Gym,Badminton and Nature. I like school,because you can get involved in lots of different activities and don't get bored. We go on school trips to places like Chatterly Whitfield Mine and Shugborough Camp.
